Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: The substantive difference between between soloing and mining alone in the public pool is a question of latency and how many of those 5 orphans may have been recognized. Obviously a small percentage, but still a measurable difference.

profit switcher being functional is 2-3 weeks out depending on a couple current involvements.
That being said, it will not ever include pirate because that would involve accounts and I have objections to using logins/accounts

Content: Right, Pirate has it's own addresses. The more (somewhat) liquid ones of the other coins in the ecosystem you can include... then connect that 'transaction watcher' that some people are running on the asset chains.... hmmm now I am dreaming, I know but... how else would you know that someone appreciates your work if you never get an attaboy for it?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
` Pirate has it's own addresses.`
It's not about the address, itself; it has a different key structure so you can't use a shared key address to mine across other coins and it at the same time

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: as far as the mechanics of the switcher, it's a combination of current block diff and current market price

Author: BlackJesus#6161
Content: @ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢 you could just code for it's different key structure. Make your username an integer that defaults to the string of your shared key wallet if nothing is entered otherwise specify it.

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: @BlackJesus I've given it thought and imo, it would be too confusing for users to have a username that is 2 pubkeys or even using 1 of them as pw

Author: BlackJesus#6161
Content: Your the only person using the code right? I mean worse comes to worse someone doesn't change your default public key and they mine to you lol.

Author: BlackJesus#6161
Content: Just store a default string pub key and call it when the field is empty

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: each miner has their own pubkey

Author: BlackJesus#6161
Content: You're mining to multiple pub keys?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
with profit-switch, instead of address, you use a pubkey that works across multiple different coins
z addys and transparent addys don't even share the same *type* of keying, so it will not work the same way

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: the user would have to supply *both* z and t

Author: BlackJesus#6161
Content: Oh ok

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: about 44k i guess

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: ouch

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @SHossain did you force the fans to run at a lower RPM ? i vaguely remember you saying something about that

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: I kept everything running normal and default.

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: No change at all

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @SHossain depending on your batch, they have diff shelf-lives. You should be able to either 1) underclock all hashboards so that they all run OR 2) remove one hash board and then run the others at normal/OC/etc speeds

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: they will run with either 1, 2 or 3 hashboards inside. CG probably knows much more

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: sometimes people burn a hashboard and still run it with 2. And somepeople re-organize the hashboards in many miners, so that they can OC some miners more, and concentrate hashboards that will only run slower into a few miners. that shit is beyond what i do, but i know people do it

Author: SHossain#0007
Content: Thanks @dukeleto. i pulled out the plug yesterday. will test the boards in few days when i get some free time
